material.mattext: What is the 99% confidence interval for μ? Interpret it in context.

R gives us:
> conf.int(birthweight$birthweight,500,0.99) [1] sample size: 125 sample mean: 3111.36 [1] 99 % confidence interval: ( 2996.16541157657, 3226.55458842343 )
Thus, we are 99% confident that the mean birth weight of first babies to mothers who are 35 or older is between 2996 and 3227 grams.
